title: Error running cargo fix --edition --allow-dirty on nightly with const generics

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use rusty_ulid::Ulid; fn main() { println!("Hello, world!"); } #[derive(Debug, Copy, Clone, Ord, PartialOrd, PartialEq, Eq, Hash)] pub struct A(Ulid); #[derive(Debug, Copy, Clone, Ord, PartialOrd, PartialEq, Eq, Hash)] pub struct B(usize); #[derive(Debug, Clone)] pub struct C { node_list: Vec>, sorted_node_list: Vec, } impl C { pub fn rem(mut self, node: A) -> Result { self.sorted_node_list .iter() .position(|n| *n == node) .map(|pos| self.sorted_node_list.remove(pos)); Ok(self) } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.0-nightly (e269e6bf4 2021-10-26) binary: rustc commit-hash: e269e6bf47f40c9046cd44ab787881d700099252 commit-date: 2021-10-26 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.58.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` expected const for `GRAPH_ID/#0` (Const { ty: usize, val: Param(GRAPH_ID/#0) }/0) but found Type(dir_graph::star::Star) when substituting substs=[dir_graph::sta r::Star, std::alloc::Global] ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\subst.rs:560:17: expected const for `GRAPH_ID/#0` (Const { ty: usize, val: Param(GRAPH_ID/#0) }/0) but found Type(dir_graph::star::Star) when substituting substs=[dir_graph::sta r::Star, std::alloc::Global] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/e269e6bf47f40c9046cd44ab787881d700099252\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:1094:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fff79428b4f - ::fmt::h4287336b592e4e30 1: 0x7fff7945280a - core::fmt::write::h8a2c40ddb66ccc71 2: 0x7fff7941b4f8 - ::fmt::h37489b9473b33977 3: 0x7fff7942c2a6 - std::panicking::take_hook::hf14c76592f73c762 4: 0x7fff7942bd8c - std::panicking::take_hook::hf14c76592f73c762 5: 0x7fff67f8aa85 - ::check_name 6: 0x7fff7942cbb9 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hbc0e9c80ca88eac0 7: 0x7fff6c3f5f40 - ::fmt 8: 0x7fff6c3ea8e9 - ::fmt 9: 0x7fff6ca0ca41 - rustc_middle[68438b5bfe988d4e]::ty::context::invalid_hir_id_for_typeck_results 10: 0x7fff6c549e90 - ::lift_to_tcx 11: 0x7fff6c5492f2 - ::lift_to_tcx 12: 0x7fff6c549212 - ::lift_to_tcx 13: 0x7fff6c3ddc30 - ::fmt 74: 0x7fff68026788 - ::fmt 75: 0x7fff7943927c - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::he49a5cdb1d3d1cfc 76: 0x7ff807697034 - BaseThreadInitThunk 77: 0x7ff807902651 - RtlUserThreadStart note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (e269e6bf4 2021-10-26) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [adt_significant_drop_tys] computing when `dir_graph::SimpleDirectedGraph` has a significant destructor #1 [has_significant_drop_raw] computing whether `dir_graph::SimpleDirectedGraph` has a significant drop #2 [typeck] type-checking `dir_graph::::with_removed_node` #3 [typeck] type-checking `dir_graph::::with_removed_node::{closure#0}` #4 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #5 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
